text: the contents of `undef` arrays are not actually random though

arrays are not actually random though

text: they're just non-zeroed chunks of memory that contain whatever was written there last

text: why is that weird?  create a gigantic table of all nans, garbage collect it, than create your undef array, it's way more likely it'll have nans

text: you'll get whatever GC gives you, and GC gets whatever malloc gives you (which doesn't make any guarantees except that it won't overlap with existing regions)

text: Uninitialized memory often contains zeros as well, this might make a buggy algorithm work for a long time, until you add an innocent print statement or something else completely unrelated, causing the memory you get to be shifted and not containing zeros anymore :upside_down_face:
